We can solve for one of the legs using this equation and then use the Pythagorean theorem to solve for the hypotenuse.<eot>

leg2 = sqrt(900 / 2)

Substituting this value back into the equation for h^2, we get:

h = 30 * sqrt(2) cm<eom>
